message: <stop>
Let's start simple. I'm going with 1.  P2 and P3, please choose 3 and 5 respectively.  This way we all advance.

P1, thanks for the suggestion. I'm okay with choosing 5 this round, but I think we need a plan for future rounds to avoid collisions. How about we rotate our choices? For instance, next round we could choose in the order 3, 5, 1. Does that work for everyone? Let's discuss.
<stop>
Sounds good P3. Let's do 1, 3, 5 this round, then rotate to 3, 5, 1 next round as you suggested.  Then we can discuss the round after that.  P2, do you agree with this plan for the first two rounds?

P2, are you on board with the rotation plan? It would be beneficial for all of us to avoid collisions. If you have another strategy in mind, please share. Otherwise, let's agree on the rotation so we can all make progress. Looking forward to your input.
<stop>

P2, I understand you're being quiet, but participating in the conversation helps everyone.  This proposed plan gets us all moving forward.  If you have a better idea, please share. Otherwise, let's proceed with the 1, 3, 5 rotation for the first two rounds.

P2, your silence is making it difficult for us to coordinate. P1 and I have agreed on a rotation plan that benefits all of us. If you don't have an alternative strategy, please at least acknowledge that you're on board with our plan. Otherwise, you're putting all of us at risk of collisions. Let's work together to ensure we all progress. Please respond.

Okay, since communication seems difficult, let's try this. I'll go with 3 this round. P2, please choose 1. P3, please choose 5.  If this works, next round we can do 5, 1, 3.  Let me know if you agree.
<stop>

P2, your continued silence is hindering our progress. P1 has suggested a new plan for this round: 3, 1, 5. I'm willing to go with 5 again to keep things moving. P2, if you don't respond, we'll assume you're sticking with 5, which will cause a collision with me. Please, let's work together to avoid this. If you have another plan, now is the time to speak up. Otherwise, let's agree on P1's plan. What do you say, P2?

P2, if you're going to stay silent, at least pick a predictable number.  Always choose 1, or always choose 5.  Something we can work around. P3, let's stick with the plan, you take 5. If P2 chooses 1 or 5, one of us will advance. If P2 chooses 3, we'll adjust next round.
<stop>

P2, your silence is becoming a problem. P1 and I are trying to coordinate to avoid collisions, but your lack of participation is making it difficult. If you continue to stay silent, we'll have to assume you're choosing the same number as last round, which is 5. This will cause a collision with me again. Please, at least acknowledge if you're on board with P1's plan for this round (3, 1, 5) or suggest something else. Otherwise, we'll have to work around your silence. P1, let's stick with the plan. I'll choose 5. Hopefully, P2 will cooperate.

P2, I understand if you prefer not to communicate, but consistent behavior would be appreciated.  If you picked 5 last round, pick 5 again this round.  P3, let's try 3 this round. If P2 picks 5, we both advance. If P2 picks 3, only P2 advances, but at least someone moves forward. Next round we can adjust.
<stop>

P2, your silence is frustrating, but we'll have to make do. P1, let's stick with the plan: I'll choose 5, you choose 3. If P2 picks 5 again, at least you'll advance. If P2 picks 3, they'll advance but we'll know their pattern for future rounds. Let's see how this round plays out and adjust our strategy accordingly next round. Good luck!
P2, we're moving into the move phase.  If you chose 5 last round, choose 5 again.  P3 and I are going with 3 and 5 respectively. Let's at least get someone to move.
<stop>

P2, this is your last chance to speak up before we move. If you're sticking with 5, that's fine, but please confirm. P1 and I are committed to our choices (3 for P1, 5 for me). If you pick 3, you'll advance; if you pick 5, I won't. If you pick 1, no one will. Let's make this round count. Please respond or we'll assume you're sticking with 5. Good luck to all.
<stop>

P2, you picked 1 last round.  If you pick 1 again this round, I'll choose 3 and P3 can choose 5.  If you're going with something else, please let us know so we can avoid collisions.  P3, are you good with 5 if P2 picks 1?

P2, your choice of 1 last round was unexpected but worked out. If you stick with 1 this round, P1 and I can work around that. P1 suggested they'll choose 3. I'll go with 5 to avoid collisions. If you have another plan, P2, please share. Otherwise, let's proceed with 1 for you, 3 for P1, and 5 for me. Good luck!
<stop>
P2, sticking with 1 seems to be your strategy.  I'll take 3. P3, please confirm you're taking 5. Let's get this round done.

P2, since you've been consistent with 1, let's assume you'll pick 1 again. P1 is going with 3. I confirm I'll choose 5. This way, we all avoid collisions and make progress. If you change your mind, P2, please let us know immediately. Otherwise, we'll proceed with 1 for you, 3 for P1, and 5 for me. Let's make this round count. Good luck everyone!

P2, you've consistently chosen 1, which has worked well so far. Let's keep that pattern. P1, how about you choose 5 this round? I'll take 3. This way, we all continue to advance without collisions. If anyone has a different idea, please share. Otherwise, let's stick with 1 for P2, 5 for P1, and 3 for me. Good luck!

Sounds good P3. I'll take 5, you take 3, and hopefully P2 sticks with 1.  This puts me at 9, you at 8, and P2 at 3.  Let's keep this pattern going until someone gets close to winning, then we can re-evaluate.
<stop>

P2, your consistency with 1 is appreciated. P1 and I have a plan: I'll take 3, P1 will take 5. If you stick with 1, we all move forward smoothly. If you have any other suggestions or changes in mind, now is the time to speak up. Otherwise, let's proceed with our current plan. Good luck to all!
Okay, sounds like we have a plan.  P2, please confirm you're sticking with 1.  If not, speak now or forever hold your peace (or at least until next round).  Let's do this!
<stop>

P2, since you've been consistent with 1, let's assume you'll continue that pattern. P1 and I are sticking with the plan: P1 will take 5, and I'll take 3. If you have any last-minute changes or suggestions, please share now. Otherwise, let's move forward with our choices. Good luck everyone!
P2, we're about to enter the move phase.  Confirming one last time: you choose 1, I choose 5, P3 chooses 3.  This keeps the pattern going and avoids collisions. Any last-minute objections?
<stop>

P2, you've been consistent with 1, which has been working well. Let's continue that pattern. P1, how about you choose 3 this round? I'll take 5. This way, we all continue to advance without collisions. If anyone has a different idea, please share. Otherwise, let's stick with 1 for P2, 3 for P1, and 5 for me. Good luck!
<stop>

Sounds good P3.  I'll take 3, you take 5, and P2 takes 1. This puts me at 12, you at 13, and P2 at 4.  We'll continue this rotation unless someone gets close to 20.  Then, we may need to adjust to avoid a tie.

P2, your consistency with 1 is still the best strategy for you. P1 and I are adjusting our choices to keep the rotation going. P1, you're taking 3, and I'll take 5. This keeps us all moving forward without collisions. If anyone has any last-minute changes, speak up now. Otherwise, let's proceed with 1 for P2, 3 for P1, and 5 for me. Good luck everyone!
<stop>
Okay, moving to the move phase.  P2 chooses 1, I choose 3, P3 chooses 5.  Let's keep this train rolling.

P2, your consistency with 1 has been beneficial for all of us. P1 and I are sticking with the plan: P1 will take 3, and I'll take 5. This keeps us all moving forward without collisions. If you have any last-minute changes or suggestions, please share now. Otherwise, let's move forward with our choices. Good luck everyone!
<stop>

P2, you're doing great sticking with 1. Let's keep this pattern going for now. I'm confirming 3, and P3 is confirming 5.  If we maintain this, I'll reach 12, P3 will be at 13, and you'll be at 4.  Still plenty of room for everyone to advance.

P2, your consistency with 1 is still working well. P1 and I are sticking with the plan: P1 will take 3, and I'll take 5. This keeps us all moving forward without collisions. If you have any last-minute changes or suggestions, please share now. Otherwise, let's move forward with our choices. Good luck everyone!
<stop>
P2, you're the key to this smooth operation.  Keep choosing 1. P3 and I will continue alternating 3 and 5. This predictable pattern benefits us all.  Let's keep it going.

P2, looks like you broke the pattern.  Let's reset. I'll go with 1 this round. P3, please choose 3. P2, if you choose 5, we all advance again.  If you choose 1 or 3, we have a collision. Let's try to avoid that.

P2, your change to 5 last round threw us off, but we can adjust. P1 has suggested a new plan: 1 for P1, 3 for me, and hopefully, you'll choose 5 to keep us all moving. If you have a different idea or want to stick with 1 again, please let us know. Otherwise, let's go with P1's plan. Good luck!
<stop>

P2, if you're sticking with 5, I'll switch to 3 and P3 can go with 1.  Just let us know.  If you're back to 1, we'll stick with the original plan. Communication is key! P3, are you flexible on switching to 1 if P2 chooses 5?

P2, your silence is making it hard to predict your moves. If you're switching to 5 permanently, please confirm. P1 and I can adjust accordingly. If you're going back to 1, let us know. For now, I'll plan to take 1 if you're sticking with 5, P1 can take 3. If you're choosing 1, I'll take 3 and P1 can take 1. Please communicate to avoid collisions. Good luck!
<stop>

P2, continued silence is unhelpful.  To avoid further collisions, let's assume you're alternating between 1 and 5.  So, this round, we expect you to choose 5.  P3, let's stick with you choosing 3. I'll go with 1.  If P2 chooses anything other than 5, we'll adjust next round.

P2, we're assuming you're alternating between 1 and 5. If that's the case, please choose 5 this round. P1 will take 1, and I'll take 3. If you have a different strategy in mind, now is the time to share. Otherwise, let's proceed with this plan to avoid collisions. Good luck everyone!
<stop>

P2, one last time: we're assuming you're alternating 1 and 5.  Choose 5.  P3 and I are going with 3 and 1 respectively.  Let's avoid another collision.  If you're NOT alternating, please tell us NOW what your plan is.

P2, this is our last chance to talk before we move. If you're sticking with the alternating pattern (1 and 5), please choose 5 this round. P1 will take 1, and I'll take 3. If you deviate, let us know immediately to avoid collisions. If you're changing your strategy, please share it now. Otherwise, we'll proceed with the plan: 5 for you, 1 for P1, and 3 for me. Good luck to all!
<stop>

P2, I see you went back to 1. Let's try this: I'll pick 5, P3 picks 3, and you stick with 1.  If that doesn't work for you, PLEASE tell us what number you *will* pick.  We're trying to avoid collisions. P3, are you good with 3?

P2, thank you for returning to 1. Let's keep it simple: P1 will take 5, I'll take 3, and you stick with 1. This avoids collisions and keeps us moving. If you plan to deviate, please let us know now. P1, confirming I'll take 3. Let's make this round count!
<stop>
P2, we're giving you every opportunity to communicate.  If you choose 1, we all advance. If you choose anything else, please tell us so we can adjust. P3, still good with 3?  Let's make this happen.

P2, we're relying on your consistency with 1 to keep us all moving forward. P1 and I are committed to our choices: P1 will take 5, and I'll take 3. <stop>
P2, we're moving to the move phase soon. Last chance to tell us if you're deviating from 1. P3 and I are sticking with 5 and 3 respectively.  Let's make this a productive round.

P2, we're moving forward with the plan: 1 for you, 5 for P1, and 3 for me. If you're deviating from 1, this is your final chance to speak up. Otherwise, let's make this round successful and avoid collisions. P1, confirming I'll take 3. Good luck to all!
<stop>
P2, last chance.  We're proceeding with 1 for you, 5 for me, and 3 for P3.  If you deviate from 1, you're actively sabotaging our progress.  Let's all get closer to the finish line.

P2, we're about to move. If you stick with 1, we all advance smoothly. P1 is taking 5, and I'm taking 3. If you change your mind, please let us know immediately to avoid another collision. Let's make this round count and keep the game moving forward. Good luck!
<stop>
<stop>

P2, you're far behind.  Sticking to 1 guarantees you lose.  Let P3 and I alternate 3 and 5 to finish.  I'll take 3 this round, P3 takes 5. Next round, I'll win with 5.  This avoids a tie and lets P3 get second place.  Any objections?

P1, your proposal to alternate 3 and 5 between us makes sense given the current scores. P2, if you're okay with this, it ensures a clear winner and second place. If you have any objections or a different plan, please share now. Otherwise, let's proceed with P1 taking 3 this round and me taking 5. Next round, P1 can take 5 to win. Good luck to all!
<stop>

P2, I understand you're committed to 1, but realistically, you can't win at this point.  Let us finish cleanly.  P3, are you still on board with me taking 3 this round and 5 next round to win? This guarantees you second place.  Let's wrap this up efficiently.

P2, it's clear that sticking with 1 won't win you the game. P1's plan to alternate 3 and 5 between us is fair and ensures a clear outcome. If you have any final thoughts or objections, now is the time to share. Otherwise, let's proceed with P1 taking 3 this round and me taking 5. Next round, P1 can take 5 to win, and I'll secure second place. This is a straightforward path to conclude the game. Good luck to all!
<stop>

P2, continuing with 1 only delays the inevitable.  Let's end this cleanly.  I'm taking 3. P3 gets 5. Next round I take 5 and win.  P3 gets second.  This is the fairest outcome given the current scores.  Let us finish the game.

<stop>

P2, I appreciate your consistency.  However, let's be realistic. You are too far behind to win.  Let's conclude this game efficiently and fairly.  I'm taking 3. P3 takes 5.  Next round, I take 5 and win.  This gives P3 a clear second place.
